intro: Opuntia cylindrolanata, commonly known as the cylindrical spineless prickly pear, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its thick, ribbed stems that are typically green and covered with clusters of spines. The plant produces large, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to red, often blooming in the summer months. Its fruit, known as a tunas, is edible and has a sweet, succulent taste. Opuntia cylindrolanata is well adapted to arid environments and is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of food.
